sectiontitle: Sexual offences: from incident to conviction
headertitles: How sexual offences data fits together
What do we know about the victims of sexual offences?
Why do some incidents go unreported?
Why are not all reported incidents recorded as crimes?
What happens once a suspect is charged?
What are the outcomes for court proceedings?
How long does a conviction take and what sentences are handed down?
details: Understanding the flow of the criminal justice system is important in order to identify how and why sexual offence cases drop out at various points. Although we can’t follow specific cases the whole way through, and we can’t directly compare data from different stages of the system, looking at the whole process together builds up a picture of the path of sexual offence through the system.
